New Records: Youri Tielemans scored the third-fastest goal in European Championship history after just 73 seconds.
Kevin De Bruyne scored the second goal for Belgium, doubling their lead.
Key Match Events: Belgium scored the first goal of the match through Youri Tielemans after just 73 seconds.
Kevin De Bruyne scored the second goal for Belgium, securing their 2-0 victory.
Pre-Game Insights: There was a fair amount of talk as to whether the remaining remnants of Belgiumâ€™s golden generation could take what might just be their final chance to do something historic on the grandest stage.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory leaves Group E as open as it could possibly be.
With De Bruyne on form like this, Belgium really should be favourites to beat Ukraine and seal their passage into the knockout stage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: All four teams in Group E at Euro 2024 head into Matchday 3 tied on three points.
This marks the first time in the history of the UEFA European Championship group stage that all four teams in a single group will be level on points going into the final matchday.
Others: Jan Vertonghen became the third-oldest player to appear for Belgium at a major tournament, aged 37 years and 59 days.
